bib_record.title: Determination of cross sections for the 238U(n,3n)236U reaction induced by 14-MeV neutrons with accelerator mass spectrometry

free_txt: Guangxi University, Nanning, China
HI-13 tandem accelerator for accelerator
mass spectrometry.
The uncertainties in incident neutron energies are
included in neither the uncertainty of the neutron
flux nor the cross-section values in the experiment.
Since neither neutron source nor sample is a
geometrical "point", neutron energy dispersion is
inevitable in any experiment. Users of cross-section
values may therefore be aware of the uncertainty in
incident neutron energy. (Commented by author)

An Au-Si surface barrier detector was used as
the energy detector for mass/charge discrimination.
The secondary electrons induced by the
incoming ions at a 7 ug/cm2 carbon foil (with a
diameter of 30 mm) were reflected by an electrostatic
mirror, collected and multiplied by the MCPLT.
Total uncertainty is the combination of the
uncertainties in integral neutron flux, determined by
gamma-ray spectrometric measurement of the activated
monitor and the 236U/238U, determined by AMS.
The uncertainties of the accompanying
alpha particle counting statistics is less than 0.1%.

HI-13 tandem accelerator for accelerator
mass spectrometry.
The thickness of the solid tritium-titanium
target used in the generator was 1.0 mg/cm2 and the
energy of incident D beam was 300 keV.
The TOF system consisted of a microchannel
plate (start detector) and a gold-silicon surface
barrier detector (stop detector). The two detectors
were separated by a flight path of 1.8 m.
This facility is based on an HI-13 accelerator
equipped with a cesium sputter ion source. The
dedicated injector is composed of a 90 degree
spherical electrostatic analyzer (SESA), a 112 degree
double focusing analyzing magnet (DFMA) and some ion-
optical elements. The SESA has a curvature radius of
750 mm and maximum electric field strength of 4 kV/cm.
The DFMA has a bending radius of 800 mm and a maximum
magnetic field of 1.3 T.
The sample was made of 99.99% purity U3O8 powder with
a diameter of 5 mm, and sandwiched between two disks
made of thin Co foils. The high-purity (99.999%) Co
monitors had diameters of 5 mm and thicknesses of 0.2
mm.
All measured reactions data and monitor
reaction data are taken from J,PR/C,87,014612,2013.
